Question: On average, how many hours per week have you spent on this course or section, including attending classes, doing readings, reviewing notes, writing papers, and any other course-related work?
Question: Please identify what you consider to be the strengths of the course (or section).
Information taught during the course can be applied to my current co-op position and many other roles in manufacturing
Homeworks, Presentations are brief, clear, and easy to understand, and how interactive the class is

Dr. Maier is well prepared, has plenty of examples, breaks the material down in a very digestible way. He excels at explaining and demonstrating how to integrate the material we learn into our jobs/ life
Question: Please identify area(s) where you think the course (or section) could be improved.
I think that time studies should be taught earlier. I learned a lot from those and would have made big changes to the line had there been more time before the line was frozen.

Maybe providing more insightful feedback for homeworks that are not correct.
I think allowing people to choose their teams would alleviate a lot of stress. Additionally, maybe, lowering the amount of homeworks in addition to our lab work
Question: Feedback for other students: What advice would you give to another student who is considering taking this course (or section)?

Question: Comments:
Loved the class and the professor.

Again, Dr, Maier is by far one of the best professors I have had here at Kettering. He excels at teaching the material in a way that sticks with his students for life. He is teaching is very applicable as well.
